head.title: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week included today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.54 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 4.85 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.42 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week included today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.54 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 4.85 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.42 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TODAY
Rockwall, Tex., Independent School District, $84 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TOMORROW
Alabama Housing Finance Authority, $50 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Santa Rosa, Calif., Housing School District, $56.4 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Utah, $75 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Seattle School District, $375 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
California Baptist University, $120 million of debt securities. George K. Baum.
California, $2.5 billion of general obligation bonds. Citigroup Global Markets.
Chicago O'Hare Airport, $109 million of debt securities for Illinois American Airport. Citigroup Global Markets.
City of Chicago, $60 million of single-family mortgage revenue bonds. George K. Baum.
City of El Paso, Tex., $100 million of debt securities. Banc of America Securities.
City of Houston Combined Utility System, $400 million of first lien revenue refunding bonds. Siebert Brandford Shank.
City of Lenexa, Kan., Health Care Facility, $69 million of revenue refunding and improvement bonds for Lakeview Village. Ziegler Capital Markets.
City of Steubenville, Ohio, Trinity Health, $50 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Connecticut Housing Finance Authority, $59 million of debt securities for Mortgage Finance Program. UBS Securities.
Connecticut Housing Finance Authority, $73.4 million of debt securities for Mortgage Finance Program. UBS Securities.
County of Chester, Pa., $63 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Delaware Valley Regional Finance Authority, $60 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Denver Airport, $240 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Dormitory Authority of the State of New York, $50 million of Columbia University bonds. Lehman Brothers.
El Paso, Tex., Independent School District, $100 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Floresville, Tex., Independent School District, $50 million of unlimited tax school building bonds. First Southwest.
Frenship, Tex., Independent School District, $80 million of unlimited tax school building bonds for Lubbock and Hockley Counties. Morgan Keegan.
Illinois Finance Authority, $250 million of revenue bonds for the University of Chicago. Goldman, Sachs.

Illinois Finance Authority; City of Crown Point, Ind.; County of Pottawattamie, Iowa; and Industrial Development Authority of the City of Joplin, Mo. (Christian Homes Inc.) $79.7 million of debt securities. Ziegler Capital Markets Group.
Massachusetts Health and Educational Partners Health, $100 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns.
Massachusetts Port Authority, $112 million of debt securities for Bosfuel. Morgan Stanley.
McHenry, Ill., Conservation District, $73 million of debt securities. Raymond James & Associates.
Miami-Dade County, Fla., $112 million of general infrastructure revenues. Wachovia Bank.
Nebraska Investment Finance Authority, $100 million of single-family housing revenue bonds. Lehman Brothers.
New York City, Housing Development Corporation, $60 million of debt securities. Bear Stearns.
New York City Industrial Development Agency, $105 million debt securities for Polytech University. JPMorgan Securities.
New York City Industrial Development Authority, $103 million of debt securities for Polytechnic. JPMorgan Securities.
Orange County, Fla., $168 million of certificates of participation. Citigroup Global Markets.
Parish of St. John the Baptist, La., $1 billion of fixed-rate revenue bonds for Marathon Oil Corporation Project. Morgan Stanley.
Rhode Island Tobacco, $220 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Rockdale County, Ga., Development Authority, $125 million of debt securities for Visy Paper. Bear, Stearns.
Sheldon, Tex., Independent School District, $52 million of debt securities. RBC Capital Markets.
The University of North Florida Financing Corporation, $110.2 million of capital improvement revenue bonds for the Housing Project. RBC Capital Markets.
University of Vermont, $160 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
